intro: Hieracium impexum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, consisting of ray florets surrounding a central disk, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium impexum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
